turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I'm looking for some fashion recommendations, but I'm on a pretty tight budget. Can you help?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Yes, I can definitely help with that! To give you the best recommendations, could you tell me what your budget is? Also, what kind of style are you generally interested in (e.g., casual, formal, streetwear)?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, so I'd like to keep it under $100 for a whole outfit. I like a casual, slightly edgy look. Think jeans, t-shirts, maybe a jacket. Nothing too fancy.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Alright, under $100 for a casual, edgy outfit. I can work with that! Based on your preferences, I recommend looking at retailers like ASOS, H&M, and Zara. They usually have good sales and trendy pieces.  I'd suggest starting with a pair of black skinny jeans ($30-40), a graphic tee ($15-20), and a denim jacket ($30-40). That leaves you some wiggle room. Does that sound good?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: That sounds pretty good, thanks. But, how do you account for the different qualities of the items from those retailers? ASOS and Zara, for example, can be a bit hit-or-miss with the quality.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: You're right, that's a valid point. Quality can vary. I don't have real-time data on every item's quality unfortunately, as that is constantly changing and dependent on the retailer. However, I can suggest checking customer reviews on the retailer's websites to get a sense of the quality before you purchase. You might also look for items made from better materials like cotton instead of synthetic materials to ensure better quality. For a jacket, consider thrifting, you might find something great at a lower price point.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, that makes sense, and thanks for the thrifting suggestion! I'm a little confused. I'm not sure where to start looking, even with the retailers. Is there a way to filter by budget on their websites?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Yes, absolutely! All three retailers have filter options that allow you to sort by price. On the ASOS website, for instance, you can select the 'Price' filter under the 'Filter & Sort' options. On H&M and Zara, you'll find similar options. They usually allow you to set a maximum price. Just set it to whatever is comfortable for you - $30, $50, etc.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Awesome, that's perfect! Thanks so much for your help; I feel like I have a plan now.
